summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2020 between FBI Special Agent (NY) and attorney Brittany Henderson, coordinating interviews for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails also involve attorneys Brad Edwards and Maria Kelljchian, discussing scheduling and the possibility of obtaining FBI interview records (302s).

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein victims, coordinating interview schedules with the FBI for her clients.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails, involved in the legal representation of Epstein victims.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails regarding the coordination of victim interviews with the FBI.

persons.name: Special Agent (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, scheduling interviews with Epstein victims.

connections.description: Attorney and FBI agent coordinating schedules for victim interviews.

events.title: Proposed victim interview date
events.description: Attorney Brittany Henderson proposes Monday, June 29, 2020, for FBI interviews with victims.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: FBI agent and attorney agree on Wednesday, July 15, 2020 (implied from 'Wednesday works great' on July 13), for conducting victim interviews.

keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit in New York was actively scheduling interviews with Epstein victims in mid-2020.
Attorneys for the victims were seeking to obtain FBI Form 302s or other verification that their clients had been interviewed by the FBI.
The email chain shows coordination challenges and the professional process between law enforcement and victim attorneys post-Epstein's death.
